FuncDef:
The peer ssl-server certificate command enables SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server.
The peer ssl-server certificate disable command disables SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server.
The undo peer ssl-server certificate command cancels SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server.
The undo peer ssl-server certificate disable command cancels the configuration of SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server. The peer ssl-server certificate command enables SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server. The peer ssl-server certificate disable command disables SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server. The undo peer ssl-server certificate command cancels SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server. The undo peer ssl-server certificate disable command cancels the configuration of SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server. By default, SSL/TLS authentication is disabled on an SSL server.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Disables SSL/TLS authentication on an SSL server.
